javadoc:
A {@link GFileSystemProbe} interface for filesystems that can be detected using just a few bytes from the beginning of the containing file.

Filesystem probes of this type are given precedence when possible since they tend to be simpler and quicker.

methods.javadoc:
The minimum number of bytes needed to be supplied to the {@link #probeStartBytes(FSRL, byte[])} method.

@return min number of bytes needed for probe
methods.name: getBytesRequired
methods.comment:
The minimum number of bytes needed to be supplied to the
 #probeStartBytes(FSRL, byte[]) method.

return.comment: min number of bytes needed for probe

methods.name: probeStartBytes
methods.comment:
Probes the supplied  byte[] array to determine if this filesystem
 implementation can handle the file.

params.name: containerFSRL
params.comment: the FSRL of the file containing the bytes being probed.

params.name: startBytes
params.comment:
a byte array, with a length of at least #getBytesRequired()
 containing bytes from the beginning (ie. offset 0) of the probed file.

return.comment:
if the specified file is handled by this filesystem implementation,
  if not.

name: GFileSystemProbeBytesOnly
comment:
A GFileSystemProbe interface for filesystems that can be detected using
 just a few bytes from the beginning of the containing file.
 
 Filesystem probes of this type are given precedence when possible since they
 tend to be simpler and quicker.

fields.javadoc:
Maximum that any GFileSystemProbeBytesOnly is allowed to specify as its
 {@link GFileSystemProbeBytesOnly#getBytesRequired()}.
fields.name: MAX_BYTESREQUIRED
fields.comment:
Maximum that any GFileSystemProbeBytesOnly is allowed to specify as its
 GFileSystemProbeBytesOnly#getBytesRequired().
